headline.main: UN More Than Doubles Its Count of Besieged in Syria: 440,000
headline.print_headline: UN More Than Doubles Its Count of Besieged in Syria: 440,000

docs.snippet: The United Nations has more than doubled its estimate of Syrians who are living in besieged areas — and risk death by starvation, dehydration and the lack of medical care — to roughly 440,000....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations has more than doubled its estimate of Syrians who are living in besieged areas — and risk death by starvation, dehydration and the lack of medical care — to roughly 440,000.

headline.main: US Government Approves Dallas Club's Rhino Import Permit
headline.print_headline: US Government Approves Dallas Club's Rhino Import Permit

docs.snippet: The U.S. government will allow a Texas man to import the trophy of an endangered black rhinoceros should he kill one in Africa as part of a conservation fundraiser....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. government will allow a Texas man to import the trophy of an endangered black rhinoceros should he kill one in Africa as part of a conservation fundraiser.

headline.main: Iraq Oil Minister Sees $70 Crude by End 2015
headline.print_headline: Iraq Oil Minister Sees $70 Crude by End 2015

docs.snippet: Iraq's Oil Minister Adel Abdel Mehdi predicted world oil prices could reach $70 a barrel by the end of 2015 and played down the impact of the emerging conflict in Yemen on prices....
docs.lead_paragraph: Iraq's Oil Minister Adel Abdel Mehdi predicted world oil prices could reach $70 a barrel by the end of 2015 and played down the impact of the emerging conflict in Yemen on prices.

headline.main: Houthi protesters denounce Saudi Arabia over airstrikes
headline.sub: Houthi protesters denounce Saudi Arabia over airstrikes

docs.snippet: Thousands of angry Houthis rallied in the Yemeni capital Sanaa on Thursday to protest airstrikes on Houthi targets by Saudi Arabia and its allies. Rough Cut (no reporter narration)....
docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of angry Houthis rallied in the Yemeni capital Sanaa on Thursday to protest airstrikes on Houthi targets by Saudi Arabia and its allies. Rough Cut (no reporter narration).

headline.main: Sharapova Loses Opening Match at Miami Open to Gavrilova
headline.print_headline: Sharapova Loses Opening Match at Miami Open to Gavrilova

docs.snippet: Maria Sharapova is 0-5 in Key Biscayne finals. This year her loss came at the start....
docs.lead_paragraph: Maria Sharapova is 0-5 in Key Biscayne finals. This year her loss came at the start.

headline.main: New York Fire, Building Collapse Injure 19; Gas Blast Blamed
headline.print_headline: New York Fire, Building Collapse Injure 19; Gas Blast Blamed

docs.snippet: An apparent gas explosion leveled an apartment building, largely destroyed another and launched rubble and shards of glass across streets in the heart of Manhattan's trendy East Village on Thursday, injuring 19 people. Smoke could be seen and smel...
docs.lead_paragraph: An apparent gas explosion leveled an apartment building, largely destroyed another and launched rubble and shards of glass across streets in the heart of Manhattan's trendy East Village on Thursday, injuring 19 people. Smoke could be seen and smelled for miles.

headline.main: New York Buildings Collapse in Possible Gas Blast, 19 Hurt
headline.print_headline: New York Buildings Collapse in Possible Gas Blast, 19 Hurt

docs.snippet: Four apartment buildings in New York's East Village neighborhood caught fire from an apparent gas explosion on Thursday and three collapsed, injuring 19 people, authorities said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Four apartment buildings in New York's East Village neighborhood caught fire from an apparent gas explosion on Thursday and three collapsed, injuring 19 people, authorities said.

headline.main: Hearing for Black Virginia Student Bloodied in Arrest Postponed
headline.print_headline: Hearing for Black Virginia Student Bloodied in Arrest Postponed

docs.snippet: A court hearing that had been scheduled for Thursday for a black University of Virginia student bloodied in an arrest by police has been postponed for two months, court records showed....
docs.lead_paragraph: A court hearing that had been scheduled for Thursday for a black University of Virginia student bloodied in an arrest by police has been postponed for two months, court records showed.

headline.main: Cuba, US to Launch Human Rights Dialogue Tuesday
headline.print_headline: Cuba, US to Launch Human Rights Dialogue Tuesday

docs.snippet: Cuba and the United States will debate human rights at a meeting in Washington on Tuesday in another sign of the thaw between the countries as they try to re-establish normal diplomatic relations after a 50-year freeze....
docs.lead_paragraph: Cuba and the United States will debate human rights at a meeting in Washington on Tuesday in another sign of the thaw between the countries as they try to re-establish normal diplomatic relations after a 50-year freeze.

headline.main: Microsoft Wants US Suppliers to Give Employees Paid Time Off
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Wants US Suppliers to Give Employees Paid Time Off

docs.snippet: Microsoft said Thursday that it will push its U.S. suppliers to give their employees paid time off — but that only applies for the staffers that do work for Microsoft....
docs.lead_paragraph: Microsoft said Thursday that it will push its U.S. suppliers to give their employees paid time off — but that only applies for the staffers that do work for Microsoft.
